details.description: Mental illness is a growing concern in the UK. It affects one in four people and costs the economy about £70bn each year. It is also the cause of 40% of new disability benefit claims each year.
details.content:
As part of its summer showcase, the ODI provided £7,000 and mentoring to the digital consultancy M/A to help develop Plexus.

During the project, we’ve been able to contact the ODI team whenever we’ve needed to. Currently where we have needed the most support is around the press and comms for launching Plexus, from writing press releases to developing a comms plan.

– Martin Vowles, Director of M/A

M/A was motivated by having the ODI’s institutional support and a limited timeframe in which to create a working prototype. Seeing what was possible in this time inspired M/A to seek out more funding opportunities to develop the concept in future.

The confidence and belief gained by having the ODI support and back-up on and around the ideas of Plexus has been amazingly beneficial. The summer showcase has been a vital step in allowing us to create a working prototype; the associated time pressure has forced us to evolve and refine and be decisive. The seven weeks has also convinced the team at M/A that Plexus can become established and grow beyond the initial concept. To this end, we’ve spoken with Bethnal Green Ventures about applying to their winter–spring cohort by mid-October.

Collaborating with the ODI also helped M/A to connect with people who could help bring Plexus to new audiences and help set up user-testing groups.

Through the ODI network, we’ve been introduced to a staff member from the Department for Work and Pensions. Through this contact, we have now set up up a meeting to showcase Plexus and our plans. We have also been invited to attend a workshop in Whitehall, around how to best use data for JSA and Universal Credit happening in early October.

We’ve also had some support in making new contacts and introductions to help set up and run user-testing groups, and this work is still ongoing. We’ve had some conversations with Mind about being able to set up focus and user-testing groups that we hope to start working with in October.

Martin and his team at M/A are looking forward to making more connections among ODI’s global network of startups, members and nodes and the wider open data community at ODI events.

Martin will be speaking about Plexus at the ODI Summit on 3 November 2015.
